name: Hypophosphatemic Osteomalacia with Parathyroid Hormone Resistance
chief_complaint: I've been having severe bone pain and muscle weakness for months, and no matter how much milk I drink, it doesn't help.
prognosis: Chronic condition requiring lifelong management. With proper treatment, bone pain and fractures can be reduced, but complete resolution is uncommon.
description: A rare disorder of phosphate metabolism characterized by renal phosphate wasting, osteomalacia, and resistance to parathyroid hormone. Caused by mutations in the PTH1R gene leading to impaired PTH signaling in the kidneys. Results in defective bone mineralization despite normal calcium and vitamin D levels.
multiple_choice: Hypophosphatemic Osteomalacia with Parathyroid Hormone Resistance
